TopicTitle: What's the greatest distance anyone's got from Kerbol?

Articles.Content:
My record is 9 billion km, it wasn't difficult but frankly it was a bit boring, a slingshot from Jool and then timewarp....

So whats the furthest anyone's ever got?

(excluding glitches of course )
Do massless ships count? You can build a craft that escapes Kerbol as soon as it is launched, then it's just a question of how long you are willing to leave the game open in time warp.
I've done something like this at the beginning of my ca. 100 years old save, but I lost it already. Jeb retired of old age and I started a new save

I've gotten so far that the counter resets down to meters! That's so far away that if I exit timewarp KSP turns into a slideshow and crashes! So, if you want to see how far you can go, NEVER leave your ship to the space center, NEVER EVA, and NEVER stop timewarping, or your game will eventually crash.

EDIT: Heh, I wouldn't doubt it if your game still crashes without leaving timewarp. I may just see how far I can get without crashing sometime.

Edited November 1, 2014 by turkwinif
After a certain point out past Eeloo, the game starts bugging out big-time, so extraKerbolar missions in stock are effectively suicide missions 100% of the time.

After a certain point out past Eeloo, the game starts bugging out big-time, so extraKerbolar missions in stock are effectively suicide missions 100% of the time.

Exactly. This was my attempt using KSPI, took about half an hour real time:

Javascript is disabled. View full album
I have gotten to a few billion, but that used infinite fuel and a lot of the kerbodyne parts.

Before the kracken attacked;

After the attack;

My furthest is from one of the boosters discarded from my Magellan rescue ship

Not all that far out, but it's going pretty quick.

Using HyperEdit I managed to get so far that the altimeter ran out of units to use and looped back around to meters.

And no, I didn't hear any secret alien transmissions.

I've left it running at 100000x for like 30 minutes at 0.05 LY/second. That translates to something like 9 million LY.

Edited November 3, 2014 by Pds314
